sense.def: Illness Sign identical with man tong 滿痛 , fullness and pain. Zhou hou bei ji fang 肘後備急方 3: 心煩恍惚，腹中 痛滿 , 或時絕而復甦者。取釜下土五升，搗篩，以冷水八升和之。取汁盡 服之。口已噤者，強開，以竹筒灌之，使得下，入便愈，甚妙 , “The heart is vexed and [patients are] absent-minded. In the abdomen they feel pain and fullness . If it happens that [a patient appears] to have died and then regains consciousness, take 5 sheng of soil from underneath a cauldron, pound through a sieve, and mix this with 8 sheng of cold water. Ingest the entire liquid. Those with lockjaw, their mouth is to be opened [by force], and [the liquid] is to be administered through a bamboo tube. When it is sent down this way, the [afflicted] person will be cured. This is quite wondrous”. Tong men 痛悶 , pain with heart-pressure [4]

Illness Sign identical with men tong 悶痛 , heart-pressure with pain. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 18: 若齒 齦無色，舌上盡白, … 唇內如粟瘡者，心內懊惱痛悶 , 此蟲在上蝕其五臟 , “When the gums have lost their color, and the surface of the tongue is completely white…and if inside the lips there are sores resembling millet grains, with a feeling of annoyance in their heart, and pain with heart-pressure , then this indicates the presence of bugs/worms gnawing on the five depots”.
